page.title: 04HOUSING IN PROVANHALL
page.content:
Twelve to sixteen hundred families live in{Provanhall.} The scheme is 25 - 30 years old and consists of 2 or 3-storey high tenement flats. Apart from one street, Drochil St., the area is in very poor condition. The streets are littered with broken bottles, bricks and general debris. Large sections are boarded up because people are unwilling to live here.
{ Homesteading }- a possible solution
The district council empty all houses in a particular section. The houses are made wind- and water- tight, the closes are repainted and the gardens and back areas landscaped. The flats are then sold off cheaply to council tenants who also receive grants to instal heating, bathrooms etc.
